Description: Terracotta hanging lamp; oval body with a flat top and a cylindrical handle(incomplete) rising from the rear; three rudimentary lion's legs beneath. Terracotta oval-bodied hanging lamp. Flat top, with moulded edges. Vertical cylindrical handle at rear, rising from square base. Very small filling-hole, huge wick-hole. Three rudimentary lion's legs, the area between them solid, support the lamp. Orange-red clay; red-brown surface; post-firing decoration in rose-madder on handle-column.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tanis (historic - city), Western Tell House
Curator's comments: Close parallels from Herakleopolis Magna (Petrie 1905, pl. LXIX, T 25, in Petrie Museum, London) and Tanis (Favard-Meeks, in Brissaud & Zivie-Coche 1998,154). See also British Museum example from Naukratis (GR1886,0401.1377). Petrie, W.M.Fl. 1905, Roman Ehnasya (Herakleopolis Magna), 1904, London. Brissaud, P. & Zivie-Coche, C. 1998. Tanis: travaux récents sur le tell Sân el-Hagar: Mission française des fouilles de Tanis, 1987-1997. Mission Française des fouilles de Tanis. Paris.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (1996)
